data.title: Utah
data.text:
The file of Utah Daltons consists of Births, Marriages, a very long list of Burials/Cemeteries (contributed by Rodney Dalton of Utah) and 1880 Census enumerations. All variants of Dalton have been preserved. There is a fair sized number of Daltons who were recruited in England, Scotland, Wales, Pennsylvania and New York.

All data is formatted by County including Cemetery listings. Additional listings will be processed as received. There are over 1700 surname entries in this file and it can be searched using the Edit/Find function of your browser. Be aware that Births within the same family unit are often recorded in different counties. Many of the Cemetery listings contain names with date of birth and names of parents that are not present in the Birth list.All spellings have been maintained as recorded and it is the onus of the user to verify the data. Our appreciation is extended to Rodney for his assistance.

Readers please note: Many Daltons of the Utah line are charted in "The Pedigree of the Daltons in America". It was published in DGS Journal, Vol. 2, 1971 and is indexed in Back Issues on the DGS web site.

This page was last updated 25 July, 2009.

PARDONS GRANTED TO PRISONERS IN UTAH Top

From the Utah State Records Office -

Pardon Applications Submitted to the Board of Pardons

Transcribed by Rodney Dalton, Utah

Orson Dalton - sentenced 1896

son of Charles Wakeman & Elizabeth Allred Dalton of Circleville, Utah. Sentenced to 1 year in the Utah State Prison for grand larceny that occurred in Loa, Wayne Co., Utah on 10 November 1896.

He submitted a request for a pardon April 1897, which was granted.

James Edward Dalton - sentenced 1902

son of Edward & Lizzina Warren Dalton of Parowan, Utah. He was sentenced to 3 years in Utah State Prison for assault to commit robbery on 18 December 1902 in Salt Lake City, Utah.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.

John S. Dalton - sentenced 1912

son of Edward Meeks & Emily Stevens Dalton of Parowan, Utah. He was sentenced to 2 years in the Utah State Prison on 3 May 1912, for grand larceny in Parowan, Utah.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.

Clarence E. Dalton - sentenced 1912

son of Edward Meeks & Helen Clark Dalton of Parowan, Utah. He was sentenced to 30 months in Utah State Prison for adultery 3 May 1912 in Parowan, Utah.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.

Jack J. Dalton - sentenced 1916

son of Walter Charles & Myrtle Knudsen Dalton of Ogden, Utah. He was sentenced to 6 months in Utah State Prison for fornication on 2 October 1916 in Ogden, Utah.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.

Virgil Dalton - sentenced 1922

Resident of Salt Lake City at the time of the offence. He was sentenced to an intermittent term in the Utah State Prison for 2nd degree burglary on 11 March 1922 in Salt Lake City, Utah.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.

Stanley Dalton - sentenced 1932

Resident of Salt Lake City at the time of the offence. He was sentenced to 1 year in the County Jail for involuntary manslaughter on 12 December 1932 in Salt Lake City, Utah.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.

Andy Dalton - sentenced 1934

Resident of Salt Lake City at the time of the offence. He was sentenced to an intermittent term in the Utah State Prison for rape on 15 November 1934 in Salt Lake City, Utah.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.

Harvey J. Dalton - sentenced 1937

son of George William & Mable Keyser Dalton of Ogden, Utah. He was sentenced to 1 to 20 years in the Utah State Prison for 2nd degree burglary in Ogden, Utah on 30 August 1937.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.

Harvey J. Dalton - sentenced 1947

son of George William & Mable Keyser Dalton of Ogden, Utah. He was sentenced to 1 to 10 years in the Utah State Prison for embezzlement in Ogden, Utah on 17 May 1947.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.

Orville Dalton - sentenced 1946

son of Theodore & Harriet Dalton of Moab, Grand, Utah. He was sentenced to 1 to 20 years in the Utah State Prison for forgery on 25 March 1946 in Salt Lake City, Utah.

When he was pardoned is not recorded.
